Title: IT governance training for small medium enterprises
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Inayatulloh, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The aim of this research is to develop the IT governance training model for SMEs - The research carries out a series of observations on IT implementation in SMEs, where the level of SME implementation can be grouped into offline, basic, intermediate and advance levels and this research observes SME implementation at intermediate and advance levels. The low level of SMEs knowledge on IT Governance results in a low level of effectiveness of IT use in SMEs so that organizations cannot evaluate the benefits of using IT in organizations - research methods carried out through observation to the SMEs about the use of IT to support business processes and evaluate the effectiveness of IT use. The results of this research are training models for SMEs to implement IT Governance or Information Technology Governance Training SME (ITGTSme). Practical implications are the resulting training models that can be used for SMEs to gain knowledge about the implementation of IT governance through training. The paper contributes to the improvement of SMEs' knowledge especially knowledge of IT Governance implementation and encourages SMEs who have not used IT fully to be able to use IT better. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: IT governance; ITGTMS; Small medium enterprise
Index Keywords: Business Process; Information technology governance; IT governance; Offline; Small medium enterprise; Training model; Information management

Title: Technology acceptance model (TAM) for the implementation of knowledge acquired model for SME
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Inayatulloh, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: SMEs are business units that contribute greatly to the country. The existence of SMEs in each country is one of the pillars of the nation's economy. The limited knowledge of newcomer SMEs about the use of information technology has become their main obstacle in developing their business. Research methods through observation activities to investigate the process of acquiring knowledge of SMEs. And use the technology acceptance model (TAM) by adding collaboration and curriculum to the knowledge management system (KMS) model that will change the newcomer SMEs paradigm of information technology, especially knowledge management systems for SMEs. The results of this study are knowledge management system models for small and medium-sized businesses. © 2020 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Knowledge acquisition; Knowledge based systems; Business units; Knowledge management system; Small and medium sized business; Technology acceptance model; Knowledge management
Funding Text 1: We gratefully acknowledge the supporting Bina Nusantara University Research Technology Transfer Office who funded this research until publication of this research.

Title: Block chain model for regional elections in Indonesia
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Prasetya Cahya, S., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Inayatulloh, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: PILKADA or regional head election is the activity of the regional government to elect regional heads in Indonesia which are carried out directly by voters. So far, the election has been done manually where the election documents before and after the election are distributed from the polling station to the central office and vice versa about the election results so that the selection process is less effective and efficient. This study aims to create a block chain model for regional elections in Indonesia that will ensure the accuracy of regional head election data. The research method uses observations about the mechanism of regional head election, followed by design using the block chain theory. The resulting model is tested for validity to get input from political observers © 2020 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Information management; Central offices; Indonesia; Regional government; research methods; Blockchain

Title: Improving SMEs knowledge and performance with cloud computing CSF approach: Systematic literature review
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hartono, I.K., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Inayatulloh, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Alianto, H., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Information technology in particular the internet has changed the company's business processes to improve their performance. The availability of the internet opens up opportunities for companies to get relatively inexpensive resources without space and time limits, one of which is the use of cloud computing to support the company's business processes. Various types of companies have used cloud computing to run their businesses, one of which is SMEs. This paper aims to find out the success factors for using cloud computing for SMEs. A systematic literature review was conducted on 45 journal articles to get the results. The inspected journal paper were available from 2008 to 2018 and displayed 14 success aspects for cloud computing for SMEs. The main factor is organizational support to implementation cloud computing. This research only talks about the use of service cloud computing in Small Medium Enterprise. It is expected that future research will discuss other issues related to the application of cloud computing in Small Medium Enterprises. © 2020 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Information management; Business Process; Journal articles; Organizational support; Service clouds; Small medium enterprise; Space and time; Success factors; Systematic literature review; Cloud computing

Title: Decision Support System for Badan Ekonomi Kreatif Indonesia
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Inayatulloh, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hartono, I.K., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Alianto, H., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Badan Ekonomi Kreatif Indonesia or Bekraf is an institution formed by the government to support the creative industry which consists of 16 fields: architecture; interior design; visual communication design; product design; movies, animations and videos; photography; craft; culinary; music; fashion, application and game developer; publishing; advertising; television and radio; performing Arts; and fine arts. In its implementation, this agency provides assistance to communities throughout Indonesia to develop their creative efforts. The Indonesian government provides full support for the creative industry. The government provides assistance to the creative industry for facilitation of revitalizing physical infrastructure or funding and other guidance and assistance. To get this assistance the community must submit a proposal that will be assessed for its feasibility The proposal received will be assessed for its feasibility by considering several predetermined criteria Therefore, we create a system that can help management make the decision to provide assistance to those who need assistance. The result is a decision making model that helps management to deliver its assistance. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Animation; Architectural design; Artificial intelligence; Decision support systems; Information management; Product design; Visual communication; Creative industries; Decision making models; Fine arts; Indonesia; Interior designs; Performing arts; Visual communication designs; Decision making

Authors: Inayatulloh, Pratama L., Fatia F.N., Efendi M.Y.F., Viandari O., Utama D.N.
Title: A Fuzzy-Euclidean Intelligent Fitness Model (FEIFM) Implementation for Selecting Personal Vehicle
Source title: 1st 2018 Indonesian Association for Pattern Recognition International Conference, INAPR 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information System Department, UIN Syarif Hidayatullah, Jakarta, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Inayatulloh, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pratama, L., Information System Department, UIN Syarif Hidayatullah, Jakarta, Indonesia; Fatia, F.N., Information System Department, UIN Syarif Hidayatullah, Jakarta, Indonesia; Efendi, M.Y.F., Information System Department, UIN Syarif Hidayatullah, Jakarta, Indonesia; Viandari, O., Information System Department, UIN Syarif Hidayatullah, Jakarta, Indonesia; Utama, D.N., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Freshly, intelligent model is a computer science sub-domain that has been practically realized in numerous parts of real life. One of them, it is possibly able to be exploited by consumers of automotive industry to select the most suitable personal vehicle for their purposefulness. In this study, the suitability is defined by ten selected consumer parameters which depict consumer's personality. By using the combination of methods fuzzy logic and Euclidean distance, the consumer personality tried to be fitted with seven vehicle attributes. Finally, the intelligent model for selecting personal vehicle was successfully constructed based on object oriented approach. The result of simulation of 76 consumers and 22 possible vehicles is able to propose the most proper vehicle for each definitive consumer. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Euclidean; fitness model; fuzzy logic; vehicle selecting
Index Keywords: Automotive industry; Computer circuits; Pattern recognition; Vehicles; Euclidean; Euclidean distance; Fitness modeling; Intelligent modeling; Object oriented approach; Personal vehicles; Sub-domains; Fuzzy logic

Authors: Mercia, Gunawan W., Fajar A.N., Alianto H., Inayatulloh
Title: Developing cloud-based Business Process Management (BPM): A survey
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Mercia, Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Gunawan, W., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fajar, A.N., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Alianto, H., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Inayatulloh, Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: In today's highly competitive business environment, modern enterprises are dealing difficulties to cut unnecessary costs, eliminate wastes and delivery huge benefits for the organization. Companies are increasingly turning to a more flexible IT environment to help them realize this goal. For this reason, the article applies cloud based Business Process Management (BPM) that enables to focus on modeling, monitoring and process management. Cloud based BPM consists of business processes, business information and IT resources, which help build real-time intelligence systems, based on business management and cloud technology. Cloud computing is a paradigm that involves procuring dynamically measurable resources over the internet as an IT resource service. Cloud based BPM service enables to address common problems faced by traditional BPM, especially in promoting flexibility, event-driven business process to exploit opportunities in the marketplace. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Administrative data processing; Enterprise resource management; Real time systems; Business information; Business management; Business Process; Business process management; Cloud technologies; Competitive business; Process management; Real-time intelligence; Information management

Title: Information system supporting partial transport, a new business model
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Inayatulloh, Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Along the fact that the city's transportation needs is still increasing makes the supply of the vehicles to support the transportation is also high. It then causes the high level of traffic jam. This research aims to design a transportation model that can reduce the traffic jam in big cities. The research will be done by conducting a survey involving transport users, transportation companies and IT companies that support the transportation sector. Specific objectives of this research are to produce a model application supporting partial transportation as an alternative solutions to face the traffic jam. The research result is a online order transportation model with Government's involvement. © 2016 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Information management; Traffic congestion; Alternative solutions; Model application; New business models; online; system; Transportation model; Transportation needs; Transportation sector; Transportation

Title: Early Warning System for infectious diseases
Source title: Proceeding of the 2015 9th International Conference on Telecommunication Systems Services and Applications, TSSA 2015
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, KH. Syahdan 9, Kebonjeruk, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Inayatulloh, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, KH. Syahdan 9, Kebonjeruk, Jakarta, Indonesia; Theresia, S., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, KH. Syahdan 9, Kebonjeruk, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Infectious diseases are among the most serious health issues in the world. The emergence of these diseases affected by various factors such as multiple human, biological, climate, and ecological determinants. Within the last decade, the world has witnessed the global outbreak of infectious diseases. This situation highlights the need for an early warning disease detection system that would be able to detect, identify, and contain pathogens with epidemic potential. This article presents how Early Warning System (EWS) could be a proactive system that would be able to predict infectious disease outbreaks and detect the sudden increase of any livestock disease with the potentials to become epidemic before spreading. © 2015 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Early warning system; Epidemic; Infectious disease outbreak; Infectious diseases; Livestock disease; Pathogen
Index Keywords: Agriculture; Epidemiology; Pathogens; Telecommunication services; Early Warning System; Epidemic; Infectious disease; Infectious disease outbreaks; Livestock disease; Diseases
